===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わら|o1=い}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|笑う|tr=warau||to laugh; to smile}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|わらい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|sc=Jpan|w}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|わらい|hhira=わらひ}}

# a [[laugh]], [[laughing]], [[laughter]]
# a [[smile]], [[smiling]]

=====Usage notes=====
More commonly spelled with the [[okurigana]], as {{m|ja|笑い}}.

The ''warai'' reading is more commonly associated with the {{m|en|laugh}} senses.  The ''emi'' reading is more commonly associated with the {{m|en|smile}} senses.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|え|o1=み}}
the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|笑む|tr=emu||to smile; to laugh}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|えみ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|えみ|hhira=ゑみ}}

# a [[smile]], [[smiling]]
# a [[laugh]], [[laughing]], [[laughter]]

=====Usage notes=====
More commonly spelled with the [[okurigana]], as {{m|ja|笑み}}.

The ''emi'' reading is more commonly associated with the {{m|en|smile}} senses.  The ''warai'' reading is more commonly associated with the {{m|en|laugh}} senses.
